result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Nathan D Fenske was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Order for Placement - (Initial) (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

10:41 a.m.  Defendant present via video from Mendota Mental Health.  Atty Erik Johnson present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson, goes over hearing for today, defendant will withdraw his plea and State will amend the charges, and defendant will enter plea and will be the same sentence as the previous sentence.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Defendant concurs - withdraws his plea.  Court allows the plea to be withdrawn.  State files an amended information with the court.  Attorney Johnson and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Johnson requests the Court find the defendant Not Guilty by mental disease or defect on both counts.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to each amended count.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant Guilty and adjudicates as NOT GUILTY by Mental Disease or Defect.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  No statement by defendant.  

Court sentences the defendant to 5 years on each count, consecutive to each other for a total of 10 years and defendant is committed to the Department of Health Services for 10 years.  Consecutive to any other commitment and to each other.

Court grants sentence credit of 174 days and from 07/14/2015 to today.

Court adjourned at 10:55 a.m.
from the defendant

10:48 a.m.  Defendant incustody and present in court with Attorney Erik Johnson.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with no repeater and count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Johnson concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as party of a crime.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and strikes the repeater.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by ADA.  Statement by Atty Johnson.  No statement by the defendant.

Court finds the defendant Not Guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court sentences the defendant to the Maximum sentence of 10 years and is committed to the Departmnent of Health Services, consecutive to any other commitments.

Jail credit from 01/21/2015 - today.

Statement by Atty Johnson in regards to medications.

Court adjourns at 10:59 a.m.

No further exam requested by Atty Johnson.  Court questions Atty Johnson.  Statement by Atty Johnson.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on July 14, 2015 at 10:30 a.m.

1:03 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake Count Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint, has not read it all and requests the Court read it if it is a good idea.  Court reads the criminal complaint to the defendant.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $5,000.00 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with Brandon E. and No Contact with DSS & ELI.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.   Court instructs defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing regarding Counsel on February 2, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:12 p.m.
